moves.1. e4: .The opening resulted in a very closed game, were both sides avoided exchanges, until black decide for a centre pawn break with 11...d5 and after white's move decided to precipitate the action by exchanging the pawns, then instead of dealing with white threats (black had a pawn hanging and a knight pinned), black decided for an unneeded move 13.h6 after which white took the initiative and due to a cramped camp by black with lack of connection between pieces, white went on to win the game.
moves.2... a6: one of the main replies, the idea is to repel the bishop from b5
moves.3. Ba4: the main line keeping pressure over d7, inviting b5 to over extend blacks pawns
moves.3... Nf6: counter-attack the best option for black
moves.4. Qe2: d3 is the other option here
moves.4... Nc6 5. c3: to open an escape route for the bishop keeping the light squares bishop is white's main idea, and to prevent both Nd4 and Nb4
moves.5... d6 6. d3: now further support on e4, and opens c1-h6 diagonal, white pawn structure is cohesive although if black tires a d5 pawn break white might have some trouble due to the weakness of it's d3 pawn
moves.6... Bd7 7. Bc2: so white doesn't have to exchange the bishop
moves.7... Be6 8. Be3: Bg5 h6 Be3 is almost the same
moves.10... O-O-O 11. Nbd2: developing the last piece and leaving open the hypothesis of 0-0 or 0-0-0
moves.12... dxe4: ?! b5 was needed although would have weakened
moves.13. dxe4: no problems for white in opening the d column, it might even try to place a rook there latter on
moves.13... h6: ? a tranquil and inappropriate move, conceding the initiative to white
moves.14. Nxe5: profiting from the previous pin over the c6 knight
moves.14... Qd6 15. Nxc6: wins a pawn, as bxc6 Qxa6+ Kd7 Nf3 Kd8 only move due to the threat Rd1 to win the queen for the rook or a piece for a pawn in d5, and white is clearly better
moves.17. Nf3: and white is better the threat now is Rd1 to win the queen and e5 with a pawn fork on knight and queen
moves.17... Ke8: needed to avoid Rd1, but allows...
moves.18. e5: ... the fork, that wins more material
moves.19. Qxa8+:
now black has to block on the d8 square either way they lose at least a piece:
Qd8 Qxd8 exf6 wins the knight
Bd8?? loses the queen 
Kd7?? Qxh8 and then exf6 wins another rook and the knight
